DOC.brief_title: Effect High-Protein Diet and/or High-Intensity Training Metabolic Syndrome
DOC.detailed_description: High-protein diet intervention show effective reduce triglyceride increase high-density lipoprotein cholesterol concentration . Low-volume , high-intensity cycling exercise show elicit positive effect metabolic syndrome risk factor triglyceride concentration . The objective study determine combine effect high-protein , reduced carbohydrate diet high-intensity interval train metabolic syndrome risk factor woman . The second primary aim investigate effect macronutrient content post-exercise meal consume follow acute bout interval train postprandial metabolism .
DOC.criteria: Women age 3065 yr age , inclusive Waist circumference > 88 cm . Weight stable ( within 2 kg ) past 6 mo Sedentary/Lowactive ( define < 300minutes/wk light moderate activity , vigorous activity last 6 month ) At risk MetS [ define 2 follow 4 factor : 1 ) hypertriglyceridemia define > 150 mg/mL , 2 ) low HDL cholesterol define < 50 medication , 3 ) elevate blood pressure define > 130/ > 85 Hg take medication 4 ) hyperglycemia define fast blood glucose > 100 glycated hemoglobin > 6.5 take medication . Willing randomized four treatment group Any chronic disease/condition would permit exercise dietary restriction ( include egg allergy refusal incorporate egg diet ) alter interpretation data . Examples include , limited : 1. cardiopulmonary disease ( e.g . recent myocardial infarction , unstable angina , stroke ) unstable disease ; 2 ) severe orthopedic , musculoskeletal neuromuscular impairment would contradict exercise ; 3 ) sensory impairment interfere follow direction ; 4 ) diagnosis dementia ; 5 ) history malignancy past 5 yr ; 6 ) medication use impact primary outcome interest ( e.g . statin ) ; 7 ) weight great 400 pound due DXA weight size limitation ; 8 ) Uncontrolled blood pressure define > 160/ > 100 Hg .
